intro: Monnina vargasii, commonly known as the desert bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Monnina vargasii typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Its small stature and drought tolerance make it a resilient species in harsh environments.
